title: Integrating Cryo Soft X-ray Tomography into Light and Electron Microscopy Workflows
content: Soft x-ray tomography (SXT) is a unique x-ray imaging modality which enables imaging of entire mammalian cells with a few tens of nanometers spatial resolution and minimal sample preparation [1, 2]. Use of soft x-rays from 284 to 543 eV (2.34 to 4.4 nm) allow SXT to retrieve quantitative x-ray absorption information of protein content in biological cells in their native, wet state without the use of chemical fixation or staining [3]. Because of these unique characteristics, SXT has been widely applied in a wide range of applications, from phenotyping of cells such as bacteria, yeast and eukaryotes to investigating cell-nanoparticle, cell-parasite and cell-virus interactions [4].
